response: narrative=Frank Garner, who had spoken of disappearing and used aliases in the past, was last seen at a grocery store near 312 Greengairs Road. His brother, Maurice Turner, noticed Frank's absence and reported him missing. Frank was later traced by police, following concerns about his whereabouts given his illegal employment status.

narrative=Frank Garner was last seen leaving his home on Greengairs Road, possibly intending to purchase groceries. His brother, Colin Scott, became concerned when Frank did not return home. An inquiry revealed Frank might have also planned to visit a physical therapy clinic. Despite the low initial risk level, police were notified and a search was initiated. Frank was eventually traced to a location on Burnside Avenue, safely reunited with his family. The circumstances of his disappearance appear to have been unintentional wandering.

narrative=Frank Garner, known for using aliases and having once been a mental health facility patient, expressed a desire to disappear. He was last seen at 312 Greengairs Road, Greengairs. After a visit to a grocery store, he vanished without notice. His brother, Maurice Turner, reported strange behavior, noting Frank's earlier talks of leaving behind his past. Frank's sudden disappearance worried his loved ones and colleagues, including Billy Ingram, leading to an intense search. Eventually, police traced him to Rosyth, where he had assumed another name.

narrative=Frank Garner, with an illegal employment status, vanished from 312 Greengairs Road, last seen at a grocery store. Despite having spoken of disappearing, he was later found safe by police at Alexander Place with his friend.

narrative=Frank Garner was last seen at his home on 312 Greengairs Road, Greengairs. A colleague expressed concern after Garner failed to meet Justin Payne at 35 Fowler Street, Cellardyke. Traced at 1G Bank Street, he was found confused but safe and returned home by police.

narrative=Frank Garner was reported missing from his home at 312 Greengairs Road, Greengairs, ML6 7TQ. Known to have used aliases in the past, Frank's brother, Maurice Turner, expressed concern when he didn't hear from him and learned he hadn't attended his regular appointment at the physical therapy clinic. Authorities investigated his known connections, including a close colleague and Maurice, but leads were minimal. On being traced, Frank was found in Strathview Gardens, Pitlochry, indicating he may have intended a solo retreat without informing family. His habit of using aliases might have been a reason for not alerting anyone to his whereabouts.

narrative=Frank Garner, a retired chemical engineer, was last seen at a grocery store where he was reportedly buying essentials. Frank has a history of using aliases in the past, and this habit raised concerns when he seemingly vanished without leaving clear information about his whereabouts. His brother, Maurice Turner, noted that Frank had plans to visit a medical clinic following a scheduled appointment at a physical therapy clinic earlier in the day. With age-related health issues and a tendency for using different names, Maurice became increasingly worried and reported him missing. Frank was eventually traced by a concerned passerby at another location, seemingly disoriented but unharmed.
narrative=Frank Garner was last seen by his brother at 312 Greengairs Road before wandering off. He was later found safe at home.
